sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {3, 4}. Determine the Cartesian product of A and the intersection of B with itself. Then, determine the Cartesian product of the intersection of A with itself and B. Show that these two sets are not equal, proving that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection.
